page.title: 03GUIDE DOGS TRAINING CENTRE
page.content:
{Cleve House}in Exwick houses one of the{training centres}for the{Guide {Dogs for the Blind Association.}There are 119 dogs in 54 kennels. They are mainly{Labradors,}and they eat a tin of dogmeat each per day. Most of them are bred by the Association. About 80% pass the test, and the others go to good homes.
{65 people}work at the centre, and 23 of them are trainers. They wear a uniform and protective clothing when they are with the dogs. It takes 15-16 months to train a dog, and one month to train a blind person with his dog, using the special harness.
The association gets its{money}from public donations and legacies.
